adjective.description: Of a man: having a white beard; (hence) elderly, old.
Of a plant or plant part: bearing white bristles or hairs; specifically (of wheat) having a prominent white awn.
Of an animal: having white hairs or feathers below the mouth or at the throat.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in Richard Eden (c1520–1576), translator. From white + bearded.
